answers.answer: You should go in to l&d asap this can be signs of preeclampsia
Labor and delivery for a persistent headache?
Elevated bp will cause headaches. It is a major sign of preeclampsia. I would be checked out asap just to be safe. Are you staying hydrated? How's baby's movement?
Yes go to l & d sounds like symptoms of preclampsia.  It just comes on at any time during your pregnancy

Little one is moving just fine. I have had just as much fluid intake as usual. I haven't had any other symptoms of pre eclampsia,  and my bp isn't outrageously high, but this persistent headache just won't go away. Even with Tylenol and rest.

question: I am 36 weeks and have had this ongoing headache for 5 days now. It is scaring me because my blood pressure has been elevated (for me) it is typically around 112/70 and today it was 140/80. I don't know if the rise in blood pressure is causing the headache,  or vice versa.  I just know my head hurts! I have an appointment on Thursday.  Should I wait to talk to my doctor about it then? Or call sooner?
title: ongoing headache
